top_comment.text:
Born Without Arms: Inspirational Mother and Son Live Life to The Full

SUBSCRIBE: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Linda Bannon and her son Timmy suffer from Holt Oram - a rare genetic 
condition which caused them to be born without arms. Despite their 
situation, they live a happy life in a non-modified home. Amazingly, they 
do everything with their feet and Timmy is a young sports star excelling in 
swimming and taekwondo. Linda is also studying to become a motivational 
speaker despite working through the day as a kindergarten teacher. We have 
been invited to spend two days with them as they go about their hectic 
lives. ﻿

Wow, it's really surprising to me how many people there are in the comment 
section who are for eugenics. I have epilepsy, there is a small chance it 
may be passed on to my children. Are you telling me I should not have kids? 
Are you telling me that every single person on this earth who has any kind 
of an affliction that we cannot help should not have children? We suffer 
enough through no fault of our own. I got epilepsy from my dad's side, he 
and my mom both knew what they were getting themselves into when they had 
children, and I am thankful every single day for my life. Millions of 
people in this world have health conditions that can be passed on through 
genetics. I'm really really happy for you if you are perfect and have a 
clean bill of health. But that does not give you the right to dictate other 
people's life decisions.﻿

top_comment.text:
These are amazing people, I'm mortified that more of you don't think so, 
although I shouldn't be surprised with the lack of compassion and open 
mindedness I see here. SHE IS NOT A SELFISH MOTHER, SHE DID NOTHING WRONG. 
Anyone who says different is the one who is very wrong, how dare you judge 
the decisions between her and her husband, it is their life and they are 
not harming anyone or causing any trouble, they are probably contributing 
to society a lot more than most of these trolls on youtube. Some say people 
with disabilities take our taxes, well I'd happily give my money to help 
someone who was born less fortunate, but this family is taking no one's 
money, she is working as a teacher, she is earning her living just like 
everyone else. Yes she knew that her child could possibly be born with her 
condition but the doctor didn't say for sure, they could have had a 
perfectly "normal" baby, I hate to use that term because in my opinion 
there is no normal, everyone is different and unique and beautiful, but 
anyways they could have had a baby with arms or without, they didn't know, 
that does not mean they shouldn't have children. There is always the chance 
that two people without disabilities could have a child with disabilities, 
so if they logic is that if their is a chance that the baby could be 
disabled the couple should not reproduce, than no one should reproduce. 
Their are more people carelessly having sex with anyone and getting 
pregnant then being ignorant during their pregnancy and causing the baby to 
have issues like fetal alcohol syndrome or to be born with AIDS, these are 
the people who shouldn't have sex. That is why even if eugenics takes over 
and everyone currently alive with disabilities is hindered from 
reproducing, it will not stop because of all the idiots out there. I 
commend her for keeping her child, and giving him a chance at life, he is 
happy and doing well, for those feeling sorry for them and hoping for 
"peace" and "joy" stop! Those things are great but it seemed to me that 
they are very peaceful and joyful, they're like any other family. Also we 
will NEVER HAVE A PERFECT SOCIETY, even if all diseases and disabilities 
are wiped out there still will be greed, pride, slander, crime, cold 
heartedness, rudeness, ignorance and so many qualities that are diseases of 
the heart, and with these we will never be all we could be. Above I said I 
think everyone's beautiful, they only thing that makes a person not 
beautiful is their personality, being a evil, mean, person is the worst 
defect of all and that is what we need less of, we need more people like 
this family in the video. Lastly all eugenics does is kill, destroy and 
breed a false sense of superiority, we are no better than anyone who was 
born less fortunate they deserve to live, maybe the people who want to wipe 
them out don't. For once put yourself in someone else's shoes. I know this 
is insanely long but I make no apologies, even if no one reads this, which 
is what is most probable, I'm just glad I got this off my chest.﻿

captions.text:
00:01
TIMMY: I'm just like the other kids. I'm just
like them.

00:04
COMM: Linda Bannon and her son Timmy suffer

from a rare condition that left them born
without arms.

00:10
LINDA: Shirt out or in?
TIMMY: Out.

00:13
COMM: But despite their circumstances, the

mother and son from Illinois, refuse to let
their disabilities stop them from living their
life to the full.

00:38
COMM: Affecting only 1 in 100,000 people Linda

suffers from Holt Oram syndrome, which also
causes heart problems. But that didn't stop

35-year-old Linda living a normal life growing
up.

00:52
LINDA: Being born without arms probably from

my perspective hasn't really affected my life
that much because it never really occurred

to me growing up that I was that much different
than anybody else.

01:07
COMM: In 2003, Linda met future husband Richard,

and when she fell pregnant, Doctors made the
couple aware that any child could be born
with Linda's condition.

01:17
LINDA: Going through all the checkups that

parents go through when they're expecting
a baby, we were given the option to terminate

the pregnancy but it was never even a consideration
of ours, we want a family, we want to have
a baby.

01:31
COMM: Timmy suffered from severe heart problems

when he was born. At just eight days old,
he was rushed into surgery, and spent the

first two months of his life in intensive
care.

01:43
COMM: But despite his difficult start in life

like his mother, Timmy would not allow his
disability to get in the way.

01:49
TIMMY: Yeah, that was amazing!

01:52
COMM: The pair refuse to wear prosthetic limbs,

and insist their conditions have never held
them back. Whether it's cooking, getting dressed
or playing video games.

02:02
TIMMY: Ah I love this one!

02:02
COMM: While Linda does everything she can

to maintain her independence, Richard is always
ready to help out.

02:09
RICHARD: I do have to help in the bathroom,

other than that the other stuff that I help
with, she can do herself but me feeling like

I'm supposed to be helping her, I do them
for her ever though I don't necessarily need
to.

02:29
COMM: At school Timmy is treated like any
other student.

02:32
TIMMY: I'm just like the other kids. I'm just

like them. And I’ll be just like them every
time of my life.

02:39
PRINCIPAL: Timmy’s personality is such that

he gets along with all of his classmates,
they accept him for who he is, they play along

with each other, I think the kids don’t
even recognise that Timmy has some special
needs.

02:53
COMM: And when school's over, Timmy and Linda
are often found at the local pool.

02:59
TIMMY: I keep a float on by like using my

butt a little bit and I go under by on my
back or on my front.

03:12
COMM: Along with managing Timmy's busy sports

schedule, and working as a Kindergarten teacher,
Linda is also hoping to help other people
with the same condition.

03:21
LINDA: I've been starting taking classes in

business management with the hope of starting
a non-profit organisation to help families
of children that are like myself and my son.

03:36
COMM: Linda knows that Timmy will face a difficult

future. But is hopeful he will learn to live
with his condition and have a happy life.
Just like her.

03:45
LINDA: My biggest concern for him is just

what will happen if he does not find that
companionship, because with my husband I have

that person that when my parents have gone
from this Earth, I have a person that will

look after me and help me and do things for
me that my parents used to do. We really hope

that he'll find someone, we'll have to wait
and

title: Born Without Arms: Inspirational Mother and Son Live Life to The Full
